Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2015 10:35PM MagicEraser wrote: Saw my onc this week and feel like I had a bomb dropped on me...he suggested Abraxane. He feels my cancer is becoming more aggressive and the abdominal fluid could become a big problem. I did have a skin met tested last fall and it was still her 2 negative, but the estrogen receptors switched to negative. It's not clear whether hormonals will still work for me but what I do know is I just failed xeloda in two months whereas all my hormonal treatments have bought me significant time. Its all very confusing, and I get the impression that even the doctors don't really know what goes on in each individual case (of course you all know that from experience. ;-). Was just expecting him to say we'll move on to Afinitor, as I've had a list in my mind of how this was gonna go, all the easier stuff first. I cried in the office, which I haven't done in 7 years since my initial biopsy. He agreed to let me try Afinitor/Aromasin but that he would keep me "on a short leash". Meaning he wants checkups and tumor markers every two weeks. I know on some level I'm being dumb about the chemo and losing my hair when I have mets growing in my belly, but dammit I'm not ready to look like a sick person and be pitied.
Posts.Title: How are people with Grade 1 mets doing on chemo? MagicEraser Catesmom

Posts.Content: MagicEraser wrote: Looks like I failed Xeloda after 2 months. Scans show increased ascities in the abdomen/peritoneum and thickening in the bladder and omentum. Markers have increased. I do have symptoms of pain and bladder leakage. I understand this is not unusual for lobular. My concern is that none of the chemos are going to work well for a grade 1 cancer. I also had a very low Ki-67 score. Haven't talked to the doctor yet, I know I can still try Afinitor and maybe Palbocicbib. I'm just really concerned that those are my last two viable options given the way my cancer behaves - that the chemo isn't designed to target slow growing cancer. Any grade 1's out there having luck on chemo? Dx 5/2008, ILC, 4cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 19/26 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 6/1/2008 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 11/5/2008 Radiation Therapy 12/1/2008 Breast Hormonal Therapy 8/5/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Radiation Therapy 9/6/2013 Bone Hormonal Therapy 9/10/2013 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Chemotherapy 11/16/2014 Xeloda (capecitabine) Targeted Therapy 2/1/2015 Afinitor (everolimus) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How are people with Grade 1 mets doing on chemo? MagicEraser Catesmom

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2015 07:16AM MagicEraser wrote: Romansma, how are you doing on Xeloda? Just curious as you are also ILC and I noticed you haven't been on it long according to your signature. I failed Xeloda really quick. Just started Afinitor and hoping I will have a good response like you did, but already eyeing the Palbo too.
Posts.Title: Palbociclib (Ibrance): Who would get this? RosesToeses Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2014 01:39AM MagicEraser wrote: Kim, No, never had a bone biopsy and onc didn't mention it. He didn't seem that concerned with the change in hormone status, just that the faslodex is not working (since he thinks anti-hormonals can mask their true status). Although it does concern me that the cancer might be getting smarter. I also don't really believe my bone mets would be Her2, since the skin met was still negative (borderline at +1). I struggle with denial a lot, so I'm the last one to ever ask for extra tests :-). I'm on Xeloda now.
Posts.Title: Weird Pathology Results on latest bump MagicEraser MagicEraser

Posts.Content: MagicEraser wrote: Hi everyone,   I don't post often but looking to see if anyone has had this pop up.  I am stage IV ILC with widespread mixed sclerotic (mostly) and some lytic lesions throughout my skeleton.  I had one radiation treatment to the spine and have run through these meds in the last 7 years (Post initial AC/T):  Tamoxifen, Arimidex, and now on Faslodex, Xgeva for the last year.   In the last 6 months I developed a bug bite looking thing on my "good" boob - I just had it biopsied and the doctor said it didn't look at all like typical skin mets...but everything with me has been a little atypical.  Dx at 33 with a 4.5cm ILC 95%ER+ 95%PR +/Her2-.   Well, of course it's a met!  It's just in the skin but - It's 0% ER/PR Her2+1 which I guess is still considered Her negative.  I know this stuff can morph... also it is still very low Ki-67 at 2%.   Won't hear from the onc till next week and just wondering if anyone has a similar situation and can shed some light on what I might be facing.  With a grade 1 triple negative met, is chemo still the plan? Are all my bone mets probably the same pathology too?   I thought I was facing Afinitor next but now I'm not sure...Thank u for reading :-)   Dx 5/2008, ILC, 4cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 19/26 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 6/1/2008 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 11/5/2008 Radiation Therapy 12/1/2008 Breast Hormonal Therapy 8/5/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Radiation Therapy 9/6/2013 Bone Hormonal Therapy 9/10/2013 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Chemotherapy 11/16/2014 Xeloda (capecitabine) Targeted Therapy 2/1/2015 Afinitor (everolimus) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2014 11:58PM MagicEraser wrote: Thank you Penny for your thoughts.  From what I've read Her2 +1 is still negative as compared to +2 or +3, guess I'll find out next week.
